exposition.author: A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupāda
exposition.content:
It is clearly stated here that

oṁ,

Brahman and Lord Kṛṣṇa are not different. The impersonal sound of Kṛṣṇa is

oṁ,

but the sound Hare Kṛṣṇa contains

oṁ.

The chanting of the Hare Kṛṣṇa

mantra

is clearly recommended for this age. So if one quits his body at the end of life chanting Hare Kṛṣṇa, Hare Kṛṣṇa, Kṛṣṇa Kṛṣṇa, Hare Hare/ Hare Rāma, Hare Rāma, Rāma Rāma, Hare Hare, he certainly reaches one of the spiritual planets, according to the mode of his practice. The devotees of Kṛṣṇa enter the Kṛṣṇa planet, Goloka Vṛndāvana. For the personalists there are also innumerable other planets, known as Vaikuṇṭha planets, in the spiritual sky, whereas the impersonalists remain in the

brahma-jyotir

.
